Class Item

java.lang.Object
Item
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Item>
public class Item extends Object implements Comparable<Item>
An Item has a name and a positive weight in grammes. Objects of this class are immutable: after an object of class Item has been created, one cannot change the values of its attributes. Thus, the class Item has no mutators.

  • Constructor Details

    • Item

      public Item(String name, int weightInGrammes)
      Constructs a new Item with given name and weightGrammes.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the Item; must not be null
      weightInGrammes - the weight of the Item in grammes; must be positive
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if name is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if weightInGrammes is not positive

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of this Item.
      Returns:
      the name; always non-null

    • getWeightInGrammes

      public int getWeightInGrammes()
      Returns the weight in grammes of this Item.
      Returns:
      the weightInGrammes; always greater than 0

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a String representation of this Item with a "(", the name of this Item, ", " (comma and space), the weight in grammes and "g)". For example, if i is an Item with name "Pen" and a weight of 20 grammes the call i.toString() would return "(Pen, 20g)".
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a human-readable String representation of this Item
      See Also:
      • Object.toString()

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code of this Item. The hash code of an item is based on its name and its weight in grammes.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      See Also:
      • Object.hashCode()

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Returns whether this Item and another object are equal. This is the case if the other object is also an Item object with equal name and the same weight in grammes.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - another object to be compared with
      Returns:
      whether this Item and obj are equal
      See Also:
      • Object.equals(java.lang.Object)

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Item o)
      Compares this Item to o. The comparison considers first the weights (higher is greater) and, in case of a tie, the names wrt their natural ordering.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Item>
      Parameters:
      o - the object to be compared.
      Returns:
      a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this object is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified object.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified object is null
